title: The Garden of Obedience
devotional:
Eliza always prided herself on her meticulously planned garden. Each spring, she'd pore over seed catalogs, sketching elaborate designs and charting the growth patterns of various plants. One year, a particularly harsh winter lingered longer than usual. When spring finally arrived, Eliza was eager to begin her work, but a letter arrived from her elderly aunt, requesting her immediate assistance. Her aunt lived several hours away and was recovering from surgery with no one else to help. Eliza faced a dilemma: abandon her carefully laid plans for the garden or disappoint her aunt in her time of need.

Torn, Eliza sought advice from her neighbor, a seasoned gardener known for her wisdom. Her neighbor listened patiently and then simply said, 'Sometimes, the best harvest comes from tending to the unexpected weeds.' Eliza pondered these words, realizing that obedience to God's call often meant setting aside her own plans and embracing the unexpected detours in life. She packed her bags and drove to her aunt's, knowing that her garden would have to wait.

During her time with her aunt, Eliza discovered a deeper sense of fulfillment than she ever could have found in her garden. She provided comfort, companionship, and practical assistance, witnessing her aunt's gradual recovery and experiencing the joy of selfless service. When she finally returned home, she found that her garden had indeed become overgrown with weeds, but she no longer felt the same urgency to control every aspect of it. Instead, she approached it with a newfound perspective, understanding that God's plans were often far more beautiful and rewarding than her own.
image_description: A garden with overgrown weeds and flowers, bathed in soft morning light, with gardening tools resting nearby.
insights: Eliza's story illustrates the challenge of obedience when it conflicts with our own desires and plans. Samuel's words to Saul in 1 Samuel 15:22, 'Does the Lord delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the Lord? To obey is better than sacrifice, and to heed is better than the fat of rams,' highlight the importance of prioritizing obedience to God's will above all else. James 1:22-25 further emphasizes that we must be doers of the word, not merely hearers, deceiving ourselves.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle to surrender my own plans and desires to Your will. Help me to recognize and respond to Your call, even when it requires sacrifice and inconvenience. Grant me the wisdom to discern Your leading and the courage to follow You wholeheartedly, trusting that Your plans are always better than my own. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What areas of your life are you finding it difficult to surrender to God's will? What steps can you take to cultivate a more obedient heart? How can you actively seek God's guidance in making decisions, both big and small?
